name: Secret de Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a great alternative to the regular hotels that are served up as they have themed rooms from sights in Paris. We chose to spend the first night in the Moulin Rouge room and the 2 nights in the Musee d'Orsay room. Both rooms were fantastic for different reasons. Moulin Rouge is, as you would expect, more romantic and fun. Where as the Musee d'Orsay room was elagant and more luxurious. Personally I preferred the Musee room as it had a lovely bathroom with beautiful lighting. Each room has 4 levels of lighting depending on your mood. The staff were also friendly and quite helpful. The location is also good being on the street that leads from the Galeries Laffayette to the Place de Clichy. I can definetely recommend this hotel and would consider staying here again.
reviews.title: Romantic boutique hotel

reviews.text: On my first non business trip to Paris with my wife. From the moment we arrived early on the Wednesday to when we left late on the Friday, the staff could not have been more helpful in recommending places to go, or things to do. Lucile especially on the front desk was extremely helpful and spoke perfect English (especially compared to our pigeon French).
reviews.title: A true secret in Paris.
Lovely rooms, service and smiles!
reviews.text: We stayed in the Mouline Rouge room, which whilst small, was very nicely decorated and had all the mod cons you would expect from a modern boutique hotel (incl free wifi throughout - something some larger 5* hotels fail to offer).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It may not be in the most central of areas but is close enough to the metro to gain access to the main Parisian attractions.
reviews.title: 80 percent wow 20 percent ow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in many so called 5* hotels around the world, but even tho this might only be a 4*, it is up there with the best of them. Modern, boutique and stylish, would certainly stay again on next trip to Paris.
reviews.title: Lovely chic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently spent 2 nights here during a short break in Paris, a birthday surprise. Can't praise it enough, from the excellent, friendly, professional staff to the comfortable quiet rooms. Great bed too! We had the Musee d'Orsay room. Didn't take breakfast so can't comment but it looked excellent.
reviews.title: Let's keep it a secret!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only echo all the complimentary reviews already posted here. Thanks for a memorable stay.
reviews.title: The staff are the key to this hotel's success

reviews.text: I recently spent the last six nights of a five week trip in this Design Hotel Secret of Paris, on the 5th floor. I arrived very early, dismayed from a bad hotel experience the night before. While awaiting a room, the staff pampered me, gave me a big robe, slippers, free coffee, refreshments, and invited me to use the spa/gym downstairs or to hang out in the front. Free wifi internet code was given immediately, so that I could communicate with the rest of my party arriving later in the morning. Even though there was a rush to get us into a room, our room was perfectly prepared and shown to us with great welcoming fanfare and explanations about how everything worked. I was almost amused, but it was well-done and introduced us properly to the special aspects of the hotel. Much nicer than "here's the key, do you need help with your luggage. . . ." Our room looked exactly like the one in the photo on trip advisor, and the bathroom was great fun. The flat screen TV rises by remote control out of the footboard of the bed! Each day, our every wish and whim was granted. The staff do a splendid job of being warm, professional, attentive, youthful, playful, and service-oriented. The rooms, like most hotel rooms in Paris, are small, but the design makes it work. We were there for a week and were in no hurry to leave. The surrounding neighborhood is not luxurious, so you don't get the broad boulevards just out your door. However, even for a personal with limited mobility, walking to the Gallerie Lafayette one direction or the Moulin Rouge in the other direction, was readily accomplished. It is convenient to have small shops, grocers, and other places to buy food and drink at all hours on the block, along with a self-serve laundromat nearby, not to mention the metro stop at the circle at the end of the block. Whether it's Starbucks or small boutiques, pastries or wine, or a big traditional french meal, you can find it very, very nearby. A woman with a women's clothing shop in the next block altered a pair of black slacks for me in 24 hours, for free. And the slacks were a classic french shopping "find" - fantastic style for a very inexpensive price. As for the hotel itself, the style, design, attention to detail, and level of solicitous service from the staff make this an excellent choice.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel, we arrived late but were greeted woth friendly smiles and warm welcome. Room was very clean and amenities such as complimentary water and juice were a nice touch. Bathroom was awesome and the rain shower was fantastic. Service was brilliant at all times and the staff all spoke excellent english. Only thing that needs improvement is a shower curtain or door so the bathroom dosent get soaked when enjoying the rain shower. We stayed in a eiffel room and the lighting and themeing are very well done making for a interesting stay. 5 stars.
reviews.title: The Secret is out!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With only 3 nights in Paris choosing Secret de Paris proved a very good decision.
reviews.title: Loved Paris and Loved The Secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Secret de Paris for 4 nights over weekend 23/24th June 2012 for our first trip to Paris. We chose the hotel based on reviews in TripAdvisor and as a result there were no surprises and everything was as described in other reviews.
reviews.title: Excellent small paris hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good - 10 minute taxi drive from Gare du Norde at cost of approx 10 euros, Liege metro station 4 min walk away and a couple of stops from the city centre. The area is quieter than the centre but with plenty of cafe's and restaurants in the area.
reviews.title: First visit to Paris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff - have no concerns about language / welcome, all the front of house staff are very professional and approachable, and all desk / reception staff speak fluent english. The overall standard of front of house staff is consistent with 5 star international grade large hotels, given this is a small establishment this was a very pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: Lovely Themes' Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel and rooms - The hotel is a recent complete re-development of the original building retaining the original exterior facade, all the rooms and public spaces have been meticulously designed and furnished to a very high spec indeed. The only drawback to the accommodation is that the rooms are small, but I understand they are typical in size of small establishment Paris hotels, and the quality of design and fittings means the lack of space is mostly overcome successfully.
reviews.title: Made our short time in Paris better.

reviews.text: I have just enjoyed a 3 day stay at this hotel with my husband, 3 children( 21 year old twins and 14 year old) daughters boyfriend and 86 year old mum. Everyone loved the hotel. We had the Eiffel Tower rooms. They were smart and well furnished- not huge but this is Paris and we were not going to spend that much time in the room. Stylish bathrooms with excellent showers. All spotless. Very comfy beds with good quality bedding- the pillows were particularly comfortable. We had the buffet breakfast every day- not cheap at 18€ but there was a good choice of largely organic produce. Excellent croissants of course. The staff were friendly and helpful with the lady in charge, Julia, particularly outstanding: friendly, assiduous in ensuring everyone was ok - nothing too much trouble. We will return.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying 2 nights with my husband we enjoyed this small boutique hotel in Paris. The rooms are small, but that seemed to not really matter as we were always our and about. This hotel is a little far from all main attractions, but it is quieter in this part of town. Eiffel Tower walk is about 1 hour while the opera house and shopping are all very close. The staff was very nice and courteous and we loved hanging out with Marco at night while we drank our wine in their lounge area. The rooms are all themed and I loved their jet tub after a long day of sightseeing and walking... I would recommend the Muse de Orsey room as this one was my favorite.
reviews.title: This is the best kept secret...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked this boutique hotel. Yes, the rooms are small, but we were in Paris - didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room. The cleanliness is impeccable and the staff friendly and helpful, in fact, the staff reviews were the main reason we stayed at Secret de Paris. We preferred our first room (Opera Garnier) because of the bathroom size, but my guess is that the bathroom size varies room to room, not just by theme. Location is very good - easy walk to the Metro. We didn't eat at the hotel, but the staff had several good recommendations for pastries and restaurants. Our flight arrived at 6:30am and we were able to leave our bags and explore the city until our room was ready. As a side note: shame on the reviewer who marked the hotel down because she left her belongings on checkout and they didn't get returned to her:( If your items aren't important enough to you to remember to pack, then I'm not sure why it's the hotel's responsibility. Overall review, wonderful little place that I would love to return with my husband.
reviews.title: Secret little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been in my honeymoon in this AMAZING Hotel for 3 nights of my honeymoon !!! The room was clean, big and with a good view ! The Hotel is in the city center and so is really a good place to start the visit of Paris.
reviews.title: Amazing !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was excellent, the staff very friendly, and the location just a few blocks away from a Metro station. But the best part was the theme of the rooms. We stayed in Moulin Rouge. It was a bit dark as one reviewer said. If you want to lie in bed and read your Paris guidebook it's a little tricky. Or if you're staying with someone you're not very close to (the bathroom door is red glass) request another room. But if you want to enjoy the theme, this is a wonderful room. We have recommended this hotel to others already.
reviews.title: Wonderful theme!

description: Secret de Paris invites you to enjoy the unusual experience of travelling while staying still. You are welcomed into a dream-like Paris where monuments fade away only to come sharply back into focus, colours blend as your perception becomes disoriented by the blur of images.In the intimacy of your room, you suddenly become the privileged guest of the Musée d’Orsay, the Moulin-Rouge, the Eiffel Tower or the Garnier Opera House, each delicately evoked by an innovative and amazing approach to design and staging.
